places_with_reviews.name: Shri Tarkeshwar Dham Mandir, Lansdowne
places_with_reviews.address: TADKESWAR MAHADEV CHKULIYAKHAL, RQQV+W7P, Lansdowne, Malara Bara, Uttarakhand 246155, India

reviews.text:
Its such a peaceful tranquility amidst mother nature, and a visual treat for eyes. The 500m walk to the temple itself is so refreshing. You need to be there to experience in real time. Many people come here for picnic sort of to spend good quality time with friends and family.

People who studied Indian philosophy may not find anything spiritual here, but people who just believe in some story or the other can go through information board here that talks about an unknown person about 500 yrs ago who used to watch fellow villagers and keep them aligned on the right path.

The road from Lansdowne to here is very narrow and takes at least 1.5 hr to reach one side. Parking arrangements are there. Washroom is also there - though not much maintained. Rest you're on your own amidst mother nature.

The temple is in the middle of pine forest,, very quiet and beautiful  though you need to walk alot to reach the temple it's worth the walk..it's altogether a different world..and yes there are lots of monkeys you can feed them by hand they won't mind!

A temple amidst the tall deodar trees…what beauty! The path to the temple is a walk down the hill into the valley…not too down but still a 15 min walk for a regular person…but once you reach you start seeing deodar trees surrounding the temple n it’s mesmerising….ths path to the temple has bells on both sides n it’s just a wow feeling n blessing already with the energies of the bell…it’s a small Mahadev temple but quiet, peaceful n surroundings r just too enchanting…a must visit

Cherasmatic beauty Tarkeshwar Mahadev Dham 🙏 Freezing 🥶 experience but mesmerizing spiritual. Hare Krishna please must visit this place but one request don't throw plastic and beer bottles here very shameful I have found roadside wherever I stopped I have found these non sense things please my beloved countrymen don't do this it's our heritage beauty Himalaya we have to protect it. It is protecting us always. Hare Krishna 🙏

✍️Such a peaceful tranquility amidst mother nature. The 🚶to the temple itself is so refreshing 👍😎💯. U need to be there to experience in real time. Simply awesome & serene atmosphere😎🥳🙏😘 A mesmerisingly dhinaku dhin dhaa experience. Just be alert & beware of the 🐒who can grab your prasad covers in a jiffy 😁👍👍👍👍👍👌

places_with_reviews.name: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Mandir
places_with_reviews.address: RQQV+H74, Tarkeshwar Road, Malara Bara, Uttarakhand 246155, India

reviews.text: A days trip from Lansdowne. You can visit here by taking a shared cab. Plan to visit in morning and you can take a bath in the kund and then visit the temple if you want. And please wear proper clothes, shorts middies etc are not allowed inside the temple. The temple is around half a kilometre from the cab drop off point. You need to trek here to reach the temple. Outside temple you can sit in the beautiful surroundings of pine trees and click some pictures.

What a place. It is about 35 km from Lansdowne and takes about one and half hours each way.  Road is narrow but is more or less okay. Traffic is not much. The scenic beauty of way to Tarkeshwar is awesome.  Once you reach temple there is a small treck of about 400 meters. Temple is located in thick forests of pine trees. Its worth visiting if you visit Lansdowne.
Caution : Person driving the car should be expert in driving in hilly areas. Though the route is not very steep but there are blind curves and being narrow road chances of mishap are there.

I must say that this temple has an aura, a different type of energy can be felt, the moment you enter the temple area, fragrance of incense sticks will clear up your mind and you'll start feeling calm, at peace.
As you'll walk your way to the main temple, the sound of different sizes of bells will make your mind unruffled.. and the Lord Shiva idol performing tandava which is worshipped there also has something in it
There's an ashram also, just near the temple. One should spend 1 night there atleast, and go to the temple early in the morning.
Though the way to reach the temple is tough but I must say it's worth it.
Om namah shivay!
Oh oh and and the Maggie outside the temple also tastes very good! Go for it !

Full of natural beauty, greenery, you must go there
Don't skip this point saying that it is far
Whole road and the point are scenic
This is first point in Lansdowne
If you skip other points and visit this point and santoshi mata temple it's worth
But skipping this point is not worth

This is 600 years old Shiva temple near Lansdowne (38 kms from main market). The temple is beautiful and is located in serene, secluded place amidst hills. The drive up there is very calming as there is not much crowd on roads but be careful while driving.

places_with_reviews.name: Tarkeshwar - Siddh Peeth Tadkeshwar Dham Mandir
places_with_reviews.address: RQQV+H74, Gundalkhet, Malara Bara, Uttarakhand 246155, India

reviews.text: Peaceful, positive aura, One can spend hours at this place, I did not know about Tarkeshwar dham unless I came here and got to know it's significance, Temple is surrounded by lots of trees.   If some one is coming around Lansdowne one must come to this place and feel nature's beauty at its best along with aashirvaad of this holy place, there were few people who were selling Pooja flowers and other puja samagri there. Overall I would come again and again to visit this wonderful.

A beautiful, serene place surrounded by huge deodar trees. It give not only outer peace from noise n polluted city life but gives one inner peace. U just forget the time mesmerized in the simple but memorable place. The place says NO to plastics but at the same time provide steel utensils to devotees or travelers as an alternative to plastics. Well done the temple authorities

Om namoh shivay...peaceful place..if you are going lansdowne thn plzz must go tarkeshwar temple its 35 km from lansdwone nd travel time 2hours..the temple is within a valley of old beautiful trees..very calm and peace one of mah bestest experience indeed..nd its 1500year old shiva templw..must visit guyss..
If you want peace of mind visit Tarkaiswar mahadev,Very nice place ,must visit.. 67 km away from kotdwar. Located in pauri district

Wonderful experience... Not just in the temple area but also during the road journey from Lansdowne to Tarakeshwar. Peace, serenity, divinity, and oneness with Nature... All rolled into one... The temple committee maintains Dharamshalas or dormitories for letting travelers spend a night or two. But this requires advanced booking. There is a useful parking area for buses and cars. But travelers need to walk some distance from the parking area to reach the temple. Beware of naught monkeys in the vicinity... I think they have a special liking for chips and Maggie!
